results.title: The Napping house
results.brief_description: The tale of a family and the snugly heap they make on a drowsy day. The repetitive text invites viewers to join in as sleepy bodies accumulate on a sagging bed. All is calm until a fateful itch throws the pyramid into chaos. From the book by Audrey Wood.

results.title: The Napoleonic era
results.brief_description: A retired army officer who served with Napoleon recalls the years 1796-1815. Scenes depict Napoleon’s rise to power, his governmental reforms in France, his conquests and finally the disintegration of the Grand Empire.
results.description: A retired army officer who served with Napoleon recalls the years 1796-1815. Scenes depict Napoleon’s rise to power, his governmental reforms in France, his conquests and finally the disintegration of the Grand Empire.

results.title: The Nanny
results.creator_credit: Seven Arts-Hammer Film Production, Jimmy Sangster and Seth Holt
results.brief_description: Bette Davis is mesmerizing as a seemingly devoted, long-suffering Nanny. Ten year old Joey (William Dix) is accused of drowning his younger sister in the bath and is institutionalised for therapy despite claiming that the Nanny was responsible. When he returns home suspicion is aroused when his mother (Wendy Craig) is poisoned and his Aunt suddenly dies. Joey continues to insist the Nanny is responsible and life turns into a deft cat-and-mouse game between the shady woman and her young charge. Co-starring Jill Bennett, James Villiers and Pamela Franklin. Based on the novel “The Nanny” by Evelyn Piper.

results.title: The Name of the Rose (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Cristaldifilm, Films Ariane, Neue Constantin Filmproduktion, Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen, Thomas Schuhly and Jean-Jacques Annaud
results.brief_description: Sean Connery plays a Brother who is sent to investigate the mysterious deaths of two of the monks at a monastery. He discovers a secret library containing rare books considered lost to the world and dangerous to the Catholic faith. He must find a connection between the deaths and the books before a Catholic Inquisitor (played by F. Murray Abraham) burns innocent people at the stake. Secret passages, forbidden sexual adventures, labyrinths and arsenic are drawn together to create this tale of suspense and intrigue. Based on the novel by Umberto Eco.

results.title: The Name of the game is volleyball
results.brief_description: Explains how volleyball is played. Points out that the game is basically simple to play, does not require expensive equipment and can be enjoyed by anyone.

results.title: The Name of the cloud is ignorance
results.creator_credit: H.D. Trust, British Leprosy Relief Association and Richard Bigham
results.brief_description: The causes and cure of leprosy, showing what is being done in India to educate people about the true nature of the disease, the treatment given at mobile clinics and surgery to recover mobility of affected muscles and tendons. Awarded the Premio San Giorgio (Venice Film Festival, 1965).

results.title: The Naked lunch
results.creator_credit: Recorded Picture Company, Naked Lunch Productions, Jeremy Thomas and David Cronenberg
results.brief_description: William Burrough’s novel “The Naked Lunch” is one of the most acclaimed of Beat Generation writings. The visionary horror director, David Cronenberg, combines film-noir, horror and science-fiction to recreate Burrough’s expressionistic journey into a writer’s soul: an examination of the terrifying link between insanity and artistic inspiration. In a dream-like North African city, a group of American writers and artists immerse themsleves in drugs and sex, and occassionally in their artistic pursuits. Based closely on Burrough’s relationship with his wife - whom he accidentally killed - “The Naked Lunch”, though a novel that owes much to the grammar of cinema, was long considered unfilmable. Cronenberg’s attempt is audacious and ultimately successful. With Judy Davis, Peter Weller, Julian Sands and Roy Scheider. The haunting musical score is by Ornette Coleman.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Recorded Picture Company, Naked Lunch Productions, Jeremy Thomas and David Cronenberg

results.title: The Naked civil servant
results.creator_credit: Thames Television, Barry Hanson and Jack Gold
results.brief_description: This biographical film, based on the real life of Quentin Crisp, is briefly introduced by Crisp himself. Crisp is an effeminate homosexual, a flamboyant and witty exhibitionist whose conversation is as glittering as the lipstick and mascara he used to effect. The film, drawn from his own book, tells the story of his life: his youth in the 1930’s, his volatile relationship with his father, his ill-fated friendships, his encounters with authority in an extremely homophobic and intolerant society, and his rare moments of true happiness. Above all it tells the story of a good and honest man, determined to confront the world with the truth about himself, in order that they can learn to accept that he too is a human being with dreams and feelings just like everybody else. This is a witty and inspiring story of inner strength and fortitude, John Hurt was named Best Actor of 1975 at the British Academy Awards for his performance, and Jack Gold won the Academy’s Desmond Davis Award for his creative contribution to television.

results.title: The NABC's of basketball: the running game
results.brief_description: Coach Bill Foster organises the break into four major areas: the rebound, outlet, filling the lanes and completion of the break. Each phase of the break is developed in a two man series of fast break drills.
